alert.note: Alert for Adams; Weld (Colorado) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued July 29 at 10:14PM MDT by NWS Boulder
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 115 AM MDT SUNDAY... * WHAT...Small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of northeast Colorado, including the following counties, Adams and Weld. * WHEN...Until 115 AM MDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1014 PM MDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. This will cause small stream flooding. Between 1 and 2 inches of rain have fallen. - This includes the following streams and drainages... Wolf Creek, Lost Creek, Comanche Creek, Mule Creek, Kiowa Creek, Sand Creek, Jack Rabbit Creek and West Sand Creek. Additional rainfall amounts up to 0.5 inches are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Prospect Valley.
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Excessive runoff from heavy rainfall will cause minor flooding of small creeks and streams, country roads, farmland along creeks, and other low lying areas.
